Tidy the performance dataframe

Source: R/plot.R
tidy_perf_data.Rd

Used by plot_model_performance().

tidy_perf_data(performance_df)

Arguments

performance_df

dataframe of performance results from multiple calls to run_ml()

Value

Tidy dataframe with model performance metrics.

Author

Begüm Topçuoglu, topcuoglu.begum@gmail.com

Kelly Sovacool, sovacool@umich.edu

Examples

# \donttest{
# call `run_ml()` multiple times with different seeds
results_lst <- lapply(seq(100, 104), function(seed) {
  run_ml(otu_small, "glmnet", seed = seed)
})

#> Using 'dx' as the outcome column.
#> Using 'dx' as the outcome column.
#> Warning: `caret::train()` issued the following warning:
#>  
#> simpleWarning in nominalTrainWorkflow(x = x, y = y, wts = weights, info = trainInfo, : There were missing values in resampled performance measures.
#> 
#> This warning usually means that the model didn't converge in some cross-validation folds because it is predicting something close to a constant. As a result, certain performance metrics can't be calculated. This suggests that some of the hyperparameters chosen are doing very poorly.
#> Using 'dx' as the outcome column.
#> Warning: `caret::train()` issued the following warning:
#>  
#> simpleWarning in nominalTrainWorkflow(x = x, y = y, wts = weights, info = trainInfo, : There were missing values in resampled performance measures.
#> 
#> This warning usually means that the model didn't converge in some cross-validation folds because it is predicting something close to a constant. As a result, certain performance metrics can't be calculated. This suggests that some of the hyperparameters chosen are doing very poorly.
#> Using 'dx' as the outcome column.
#> Using 'dx' as the outcome column.
# extract and combine the performance results
perf_df <- lapply(results_lst, function(result) {
  result[["performance"]]
}) %>%
  dplyr::bind_rows()
# make it pretty!
tidy_perf_data(perf_df)

#> # A tibble: 10 x 3
#>    method metric   value
#>    <chr>  <chr>    <dbl>
#>  1 glmnet CV AUC   0.626
#>  2 glmnet Test AUC 0.634
#>  3 glmnet CV AUC   0.632
#>  4 glmnet Test AUC 0.653
#>  5 glmnet CV AUC   0.660
#>  6 glmnet Test AUC 0.589
#>  7 glmnet CV AUC   0.639
#>  8 glmnet Test AUC 0.574
#>  9 glmnet CV AUC   0.657
#> 10 glmnet Test AUC 0.587
# }
